snippet: The opposition figure Musallam el-Barrak, a former member of Parliament, was sentenced for comments he made during a speech at a political rally.
abstract: Kuwait court sentences Musallam el-Barrak, former member of Parliament and prominent opposition figure, to five years in prison for insulting Sheik Sabah al-Ahmad al-Sabah during speech at political rally; ruling is latest example of way in which countries around Persian Gulf are increasingly prosecuting crime of insulting or disobeying their leaders in effort to stanch protest movements.
lead_paragraph: The opposition figure Musallam el-Barrak, a former member of Parliament, was sentenced for comments he made during a speech at a political rally.
